SENT.plain: Carotid sinus hypersensitivity was first reported more than 200 years ago
Nevertheless, a complete understanding of this relatively common clinical finding in older patients has proven elusive
There is evidence to support an association between symptoms, particularly syncope, and a hypersensitive response to carotid sinus massage
However, the clinical implication of a high prevalence in asymptomatic healthy older persons is not known
A central degenerative process likely underlies the pathophysiology, but this is as yet unproven
Although selected patients have had symptom improvement with treatment, particularly permanent pacing, there is a dearth of randomized controlled trial data to guide management
